title: NHS waiting lists hit record high - BBC News

segments.text: NHS waiting lists in England have hit a new record high
with more than seven million people now waiting for treatment
The health service is facing what many describe as its worst ever crisis
Staff shortages are a major contributing factor
with hospitals struggling to recruit and retain doctors and nurses
The government has pledged billions in extra funding
but critics say it is not enough to address the scale of the problem
Emergency departments are regularly reporting unsafe levels of crowding
Ambulance response times have also deteriorated significantly
Patients are waiting hours for ambulances in life threatening situations
Cancer treatment delays are causing particular concern
with survival rates falling behind comparable countries
Mental health services are also severely stretched
Young people face the longest waits for psychological support
The British Medical Association has called for urgent reform
arguing that the current model of healthcare delivery is unsustainable
Immigration policy is directly linked to NHS staffing
Many doctors and nurses are recruited from overseas
Restricting migration could make the staffing crisis even worse
Social care remains the biggest bottleneck in the system
Patients who are medically fit cannot be discharged
because there is no care package available in the community
This bed blocking is costing the NHS billions each year
The cost of living crisis is adding further pressure
as more people delay seeking treatment due to financial concerns
Public satisfaction with the NHS has fallen to its lowest level
since records began in nineteen eighty three
Despite this most people still believe in the principle
of a health service that is free at the point of use
The question is whether the NHS can survive in its current form
or whether fundamental structural changes are needed
Technology and digital health solutions offer some hope
with artificial intelligence being trialled in diagnostics
But experts warn there is no quick fix for decades of underinvestment
The health service needs sustained long term commitment
from whichever party forms the next government
Winter pressures are expected to push the system to breaking point
Health leaders are warning of a very difficult few months ahead
